title: Peanut butter jelly with a baseball bat
body:
It's Friday, so I'll make this quick:

1. Direct your attention to the top of the page. See that new menu? That's the all-encompassing MOXIECINEMA.COM menu. It's proves, once and for all, that the Moxie blog is a "part" of the moxiecinema.com universe, and not the other way around. There's all kinds of fun stuff for you to play with, like a forum and a mailing list... and a blog even! Once the theater opens, the main page will transform into AWESOMENESS and the menu will grow seven new buttons. So... there that is.

Also, if you notice any bugs with the design or functionality of the new homepage (or any of the other pages), please let me know. I took the time to make sure everything was XHTML Strict / CSS compliant (there's even links in the footer to prove it), so hopefully it will look just as good in Safari as it does in Firefox... Mac or PC.

2. First Friday. Moxie Cinema. Here's what we're thinking: Open the front doors (the entrance off Walnut) and set up a little table just inside the doors. The table will include:

  • Robot versions of Nicole and I

  • Popcorn from the Moxie popper (free)

  • What's left of our merchandise (buttons - $1.00, stickers - $0.50)

  • A sign-up sheet for The Moxie Mailing List

  • A "guess when the Moxie will open" contest, where people cast their votes and whoever gets the closest will win something cool... like an invitation to one of the pre-opening test screenings

  • The chance to look in, but not walk through, the work zone (sorry, liability is too big of an issue in these litigious times we live in)

And... that's that. Have a great memorial day weekend everyone!
author: Dan

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: No, June 1st is First Wednesday, which is Twenty Ninth Birthday (Nate), which should get people out in equal numbers.  I plan on having an "Open Apartment" where I will display requisite bachelor-pad artwork such as the requisite Salvador Dali, the requisite M.C. Escher, and the requisite "Guiness is Good For You."  Patrons can discuss the post-modern deconstruction of 20th century hyper-commercialized art.  Budweiser Select will be in the fridge, along with a block of half-eaten Cheddar.
